headline: President Trump's media war and ESPN's political correctness

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Hi, I am Greg Gutfeld, with Kimberly Guilfoyle, Juan Williams, Brian Kilmeade and she plays hide and seek in the dollhouse, Dana Perino -- "The Five." We learned one thing last night: The media is the disease and Donald Trump is the cure.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I mean, truly dishonest people in the media and the fake media. They make up stories.  I'm really doing this to show you how damn dishonest these people are. Well, I mean, CNN is really bad. But ABC this morning -- I don't want it much but I am watching in the morning. And to have little George Stephanopoulos talking to Nikki Haley, right? Little George.  It's time to expose the crooked media deceptions and to challenge the media for their role in fomenting division. And yes, by the way, they are trying to take away our history and our heritage.  These are sick people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Little George." It got better. Trump taped an infomercial for FNC, knowing that it is airing on CNN.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I must tell you, Fox has treated me fairly. Fox has treated me fairly. Someday they might not treat me fairly and I will tell you about it. Okay? But they've treated me fairly. And I don't mean all good, I got plenty of bad on Fox too. But at least it's within reason. And "Hannity," how good is "Hannity"? And he's a great guy. And he is an honest guy. And "Fox & Friends" in the morning is the best show. And it's the absolute most honest show. And it's a show I watch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Fox & Friends." A poor man's "Five."

utterances.speaker: BRIAN KILMEADE, GUEST CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: We were here first. We were the Neil Armstrong of television.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. No. Your days are numbered, your days are numbered.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: You were in high school when we started.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know. Anyway, you got to admit that is awesome trolling: Plugging FNC on CNN. That is like ordering a Coke at the Pepsi factory.  Now, by now we know Trump's spiel: The media makes a big deal out of nothing. It craps a redwood from an acorn. But just before his rally, ESPN proved him right. They fooled a reporter from the UVA game because his name was Robert Lee. Yes. It sounded too close to Sara Lee and their pound cake goes straight your hips. Actually, they were worried his name might cause teasing because of the fuss over statues. How sad: Protecting a grown man from jokes. Is ESPN still a sports network? What is the sport, patty cake? Talk about hysteria. And it supports Trump's media analysis: When you react preemptively over a cowardly fear of something that doesn't exist, you are broken.   And the media thinks Trump is unstable? ESPN is trapped in a mirage were all things are viewed irrationally because the poor saps are held hostage to fear. Note: They are not literally held hostage, just a figure of speech. So, what's next, ESPN? Ban words like monumental or statuesque? What about players name Jefferson or Davis? But really, the story is a healthy sign: Once exposed, everyone did laugh at it. But it leads me to one question: Does ESPN still cover sports or just their asses?

utterances.speaker: KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Oh my gosh!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kilmeade. Donald Trump gushing about "Fox & Friends." When you heard him do that, did you high five yourself in the mirror of your lonely sad hotel room?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: It's bit of a surreal experience. The President of the United States in front of the capacity crowd in Phoenix -- I expect that it was -- I fully expect my mom to do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Because she does like "Fox & Friends" and she has got a lot of choices. She controls the channel. I don't know why because she even has movie channels. But I do say this.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: But that's what Donald Trump is. He is absolutely transparent in that he watched George Stephanopoulos give an interview after an Afghanistan policy about a war we are fighting and trying to win. He got one question out and it was back to eight days later. George Stephanopoulos. How do I hurt his feelings? Attack his height. So, what else do I have in my mind, I start the day with "Fox & Friends" and I like those guys.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: So, I just know Donald Trump as being somebody who speaks the truth, who agrees with my mom.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I could never be president. I could never say how I start my day.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So, gross.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You don't know what that means!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, I do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, Juan, should the NFL continue using Dixie cups on the sidelines?

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Dixie cups. Yes, that's a good question. That is about the equivalent in your mind.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That is how serious you think this is.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Hard-hitting news here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What do you make of my connection between ESPN and Trump? That ESPN somehow proved them right but they're kind of like a radical thinking. Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No. I don't think they proved him right but I think it was, you know, right before this speech and I think the conservative echo chamber exploded. I mean, you brought it up here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm part of the echo chamber, America.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: You thought ESPN was out of control --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no. I think it's an absurd and crazy decision. On the face of it, now there's a statement out from ESPN, which they said, it had nothing to do with anybody being offended by Robert Lee announcing the Virginia game. That in fact, it was about whether or not there would be means and hectoring and --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're worried about teasing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Teasing Robert Lee and that Robert Lee was going to be --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And heckling, yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: By the way -- ESPN, I might have to work there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Great move.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Who knows?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: The way the fortune-teller is talking over here. Oh my goodness!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I've got my eyes on your seat. Kimberly, you buy -- Juan buys the excuse that they were protecting him from being teased.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's kind of odd. I mean, would anybody protect you as an announcer?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Has anyone ever protected me? No! Are you kidding me? I'm like the dark board, I'm like the local, you know, deadliest catch bar. Anyway, no. What I think though is, they were protecting themselves. They are not protecting Robert Lee. They want to act like they are altruistic, and we're just looking out for this guy and trying to protect their employee. I don't think that's the case. I think they're worried that if they were going to face criticism, and it was going to be another sad round of publicity for them. But opps, that actually happened anyway because of the way they had it. And then all day long, you saw everyone was putting up a picture of Robert Lee, such a nice guy. Poor thing. And, you know, it is on and on. And now people are making fun of ESPN and saying, they have kind of no compass. Their compass is whether or not it might be bad press for them. Not about what the right thing to do is.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Right. But what about the most famous sportscaster who's been there since day one, his name is Bob Lee, why did he escape? Why would they try to protect him from a meme?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I will go by the short nickname like not the full --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I just hate it when cable network gets bad controversy. Hey, Dana, doesn't this story reveal the difference between the perception of possible outrage and real outrage?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And I think we operate the media by possible outrage, we are constantly worried about what we are going to say.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I self-edit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. You have a filthy mind. You know?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I actually do think that -- I think that they were over thinking it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I think they made a terrible decision and I was the first to say this was the most ridiculous story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But, I think that they probably were, when they got around the -- they probably have consultants who called in, like charging them a lot of money to sit around and say, we should really try to protect him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because he is going to be the subject of all of these insults on Twitter. I can actually buy that. I don't think they were necessarily happened here. I think that they went way overboard. Because every action causes this overreaction in a situation. But Megan McArdle at Bloomberg, she wrote a piece today saying that we are all afraid of the online mob.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So that you're making decisions and editing yourself before you can even get anything out because you are afraid of the social media backlash. Actually, if you turn it off, it doesn't exist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it's like a cloudy day if you just look away. You don't see the clouds.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Do you want to know how I do it? You have a pan handy? Do you want to try this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Okay. What I do is I forget my password. So, I don't log on. I have no idea what --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Your password is not "password?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's true. I know what it is, it's "I heart Lucy."

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: We are not really sure. It would be more likely to be Ainsley. So, put it that way. I can't give away my password. But actually, I am not bothered by things I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: So, I love the line --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is actually the next step.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I have no idea what's going on.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think people are going to start walking away. At least from the twitter side of this.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because there is not enough room for context. I re-tweeted something that Mike Rowe wrote today on Facebook and response to somebody who called a white nationalist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And his response is so thoughtful. But it takes a lot longer for him to explain it so he does it on Facebook. I thought Tucker Carlson tonight, he said that he basically took Twitter off of all of his devices. And this is actually the next step in all of this which is, just walk away. Walk away from it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Backlash. Backlash.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Two sets of people. And I would include Juan in this, are happier people. You don't read your ad mentions on Twitter. I don't see you ever looking at anything.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He doesn't know how.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no. I know how. But I'm just saying something, I mean, it gets pretty nasty. Right?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Ignore it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You can't. But I will say that you do feel at times like you know what? People find out things. There's gossip. Mostly, trash a gossip or someone -- putting someone down --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But a lot of that is going on and I just say --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It is a bathroom wall that never ends.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I do like it for the -- like monitoring breaking news -- I wrote a piece last week in the reformed Jewish journal, I believe that Bethany Mundell had tweeted. And I never would have seen that before but it was about this security guard in Charlottesville that was guarding the synagogue. And now a retired naval officer came over and helped him to be able to protect it. That's something I never would have seen with the course of my --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- news consumption but I don't like to look at the comments.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, and I think that the best part of it. I love Twitter for that because you can't get an access, it's like the really great way to aggregate and get all the different, you know, articles. But, you know, the cheap shots are just, you know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hey, wait a second, I thought I was the one -- you said to Kimberly that I was making excuses when I said, they were reacting to this and worrying about him. But in fact, all of you were saying, well, the social media thing drives people and they are too quick to react.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. If you are trying to expose our hypocrisy, how dare you.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: It's not going to work.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's not going to work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's transition onto something else.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Let's do it. We're "five and friends."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We turned on each other.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Any thoughts on over, we're going to talk about the media response and the people are getting thoughts on the rally?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: The really, yesterday, a lot different than today's speech in Nevada. A lot different from Mondays. I think that the President was pleased with the rally and that's probably most important. I'm really curious to see where this whole thing goes because he has not provided the screaming headlines for his enemies like he has in past weeks. We are going to have to work for the controversy this week.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'd say his base is with him no matter what. So, again, I go back to -- you have this opportunity. You could drive one thing. The most important thing on his legislative agenda for the fall is tax reform. Unless it's the wall. I mean, it could be. Maybe he thinks that the wall is the most important thing. But the House is already put it in the budget and funded it. So, I don't think -- So, it's tax reform. So, it's tax reform. And you have capacity crowds in Arizona, and they are screaming fans and you say, here is what I want, I want tax reform, I wanted on my desk by November 1st and here's what I want in it and here's why it's going to help all of you, now help me get there. I think that would be a better use of his time. I think that the bashing of the media in some ways -- I get it but there's no way to drive the headline. And then again, like the action and overreaction, it is the nitpicking on both sides.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know that it's probably not healthy or positive but I kind of enjoy it, Juan. Does that make me a weak person?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, but it's like pro-wrestling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's just like entertaining.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Little George.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, he does. He labels people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, imagine if Obama did that to you. I mean, he came after Fox --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. We're going immediate.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, "Saturday Night Live" was not --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They had an overweight man play, you want "Saturday Night Live." Remember that?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: And I had them removed --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And you do that exercise program.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me just quickly jump in and say that I thought that he was reacting throughout much of the speech last night to what had happened with the Charlottesville stuff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And so, he's going after the press. He is pulling out the speech and saying I said this. He doesn't mention he said "both sides." And then he has this guy behind him. And I found this guy tremendously entertaining -- he was a black eye holding up a sign that says "Blacks support Trump." And then you find out, this guy has twice been accused of murder. He's member of a cult. He's saying Obama is the beast and Hillary is some other --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who hasn't done that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I mean, so this is the guy behind the President of the United States.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He is literally behind him.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They should not make sure that their people --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, I thought that you're going to do it Greg and tell me it was --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But don't you remember there was somebody --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: America's most wanted.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: A parent of somebody that was -- wasn't Omar Mateen's dad --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. And if the Hillary Clinton --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I don't want to mix my facts up. Because I've done enough of that tonight.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You were correct.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Okay. Omar Mateen's dad. All right. Coming up, you will hear some of the media's hysterical reaction to President Trump's rally in Phoenix last night. Stay tuned.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: President Trump pounded the media at his rally in Phoenix last night and many in the mainstream media, well, they weren't amused.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: What we have witnessed was a total eclipse of the facts, someone who came out on stage and lied directly to the American people. He's unhinged. It's embarrassing. And I don't mean for us, the media because he went after us but for the country.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: This with incitement plain and simple. I turned my cell phone camera on the crowd just so you could see the reaction there as we were on stage. That's what it looks like when the President turns the crowd on you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This was Donald Trump at his worst. He sounded like an autocrat trying to dehumanize his allies.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Okay. So, strong reaction from the mainstream media. And you saw that across the board. And I guess it's from all the people, Greg that were not -- there wasn't "Fox & Friends" or "HANNITY" or FNC.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is for the fans. It wasn't for them. For example, it's like going into a concert of the band that you don't like but the fans are screaming, they're crying, you just don't get it. Well, that's not their fault. That's your fault. Under President Obama, I ran into people every day who thought America was heading to ruin under President Obama. Donald Trump was one of them. Now, Trump's in charge, there's another group that believes the world is going to end. The difference here is, they are in the media. They are looking for something that doesn't exist. They expect Donald Trump to stand up there and sue them. That's like expecting a qualifier to, you know, recite Shakespeare. It ain't going to happen. He's not your guy. You have to find soothing somewhere else. And the people that are complaining about, he's disruptive are the same people that are on Twitter seeking conflict.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Okay. So that's who they are.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't think people want to be soothed.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. Dana, so was the reaction won expected by the media to the speech and do you think it's fair?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, yes, to be expected just because it's a pattern. It's like the same thing over and over again. Which is why it's a little bit tiresome. But like for somebody like Cecilia Vega who was actually there on the ground. Like here we are in the comfort of our own studio and we are not there in the crowd and observing it. And that's what they are there to do. And she is absolutely free to express her opinion as is everybody else. But there could be a reaction to that, right? So, people think that they have gone way too far. I think that -- I just don't know if there is actually anything new. I did see something to Greg's point -- Katie Couric tweeted that she had watched the speech and then she said she reread the transcript this morning. She was more afraid for our country than ever. And I do think that that kind of over embellishment of the worries of the country are too much. But I also think that the attacks were, they went too far and I would have used the time much more effectively. Because that base is going to love him no matter what he says. They will roar and cheer for things like tax reform or the wall and whatever he wants to talk about.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Where has everyone been? They act like that was a unique event.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Now all of a sudden you have Carl Bernstein wondering about the mental health of the President. You have James Clapper, who is always sound asleep.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: He comes out and says that the President want out -- he doesn't feel -- he is worried about his hand on the nuclear codes. The guy who actually makes the most sense. David Axelrod said, this is very the talked of him being removed from office, of being mentally imbalance, it's a very dangerous road. That he's got over a third of the country backing him. What are you trying to do, take him out of office after he won an election fair and square?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. So, you made reference to that. We've got that clip. I'll get Juan's reaction.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Juan?

utterances.speaker: JAMES CLAPPER, FORMER DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE
utterances.sentences: I don't know when I've listen and watched something like this from a President that I found more disturbing. I found this downright scary and disturbing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Are you questioning his fitness?

utterances.speaker: CLAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes, I do. I really question his ability to -- his fitness to be in this office. And I also am beginning to wonder about his motivation for. Maybe he is looking for a way out.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Very interesting. Juan.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: A way out.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He did that rally.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But he said that before he was inaugurated.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So, he did that rally and, you know, worked up the crowd and did everything so that he could leave the presidency. I mean, that just doesn't make sense to me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think the guy who wrote the art of the deal with him also says that he thinks Trump is looking for a way out. But I don't know.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: I spoke to him in 1988.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't know. There is any significance, that is just people saying this stuff. I take those significance. People like Frank Luntz who used to do, I guess, he still does pulling who said, you know, Trump was more critical of the media in terms of stirring up that crowd than he was neo-Nazis or even radical Islamic terrorists. So, Trump is playing to a base. He's pandering. I don't think he's catering to an appetite of people who say, oh, you know, what, the government is too big. He's just stirring them up. I mean, he's just firing them up.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: But do you think he's sincere?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- bad behavior and anger.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Do you think he's sincere though? Do you think he's sincerely feels that way? He feels he was misinterpreted. He's watching some of his surrogates and his cabinet --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's what he does things.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: -- on these channels, and seeing no questions about the issues like Afghanistan. And all about personal attacks. I don't think he's pandering. That's Donald Trump. If we went out to dinner with him, he'd be saying the same thing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, but he would be lying. And that's the problem. Because he doesn't say to you -- he doesn't say to you, he says the media is so dishonest. These people are despicable and he doesn't say, oh, yes, but you know what? I did say that both sides are responsible. He doesn't say, oh, you know, I said some things and maybe they were misinterpreted and I sincerely apologize. But here's who I really am. He doesn't say that. He goes after the press.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But here's the difference. Everything you said is true. Everything you said is true. However, it's funny to half of America. When we are watching it, we are actually entertained. We are not taking it that seriously. We are just going oh, it is Uncle Donald. This is great. This is what he does. We see it as fun. The other side is horrified. Like they're watching this horrible destruction of the country.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.utterance: Who knows?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: The way the fortune-teller is talking over here. Oh my goodness!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I've got my eyes on your seat. Kimberly, you buy -- Juan buys the excuse that they were protecting him from being teased.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's kind of odd. I mean, would anybody protect you as an announcer?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Has anyone ever protected me? No! Are you kidding me? I'm like the dark board, I'm like the local, you know, deadliest catch bar. Anyway, no. What I think though is, they were protecting themselves. They are not protecting Robert Lee. They want to act like they are altruistic, and we're just looking out for this guy and trying to protect their employee. I don't think that's the case. I think they're worried that if they were going to face criticism, and it was going to be another sad round of publicity for them. But opps, that actually happened anyway because of the way they had it. And then all day long, you saw everyone was putting up a picture of Robert Lee, such a nice guy. Poor thing. And, you know, it is on and on. And now people are making fun of ESPN and saying, they have kind of no compass. Their compass is whether or not it might be bad press for them. Not about what the right thing to do is.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Right. But what about the most famous sportscaster who's been there since day one, his name is Bob Lee, why did he escape? Why would they try to protect him from a meme?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I will go by the short nickname like not the full --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just hate it when cable network gets bad controversy. Hey, Dana, doesn't this story reveal the difference between the perception of possible outrage and real outrage?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And I think we operate the media by possible outrage, we are constantly worried about what we are going to say.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I self-edit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. You have a filthy mind. You know?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I actually do think that -- I think that they were over thinking it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I think they made a terrible decision and I was the first to say this was the most ridiculous story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But, I think that they probably were, when they got around the -- they probably have consultants who called in, like charging them a lot of money to sit around and say, we should really try to protect him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because he is going to be the subject of all of these insults on Twitter. I can actually buy that. I don't think they were necessarily happened here. I think that they went way overboard. Because every action causes this overreaction in a situation. But Megan McArdle at Bloomberg, she wrote a piece today saying that we are all afraid of the online mob.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So that you're making decisions and editing yourself before you can even get anything out because you are afraid of the social media backlash. Actually, if you turn it off, it doesn't exist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it's like a cloudy day if you just look away. You don't see the clouds.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Do you want to know how I do it? You have a pan handy? Do you want to try this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Okay. What I do is I forget my password. So, I don't log on. I have no idea what --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Your password is not "password?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's true. I know what it is, it's "I heart Lucy."

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: We are not really sure. It would be more likely to be Ainsley. So, put it that way. I can't give away my password. But actually, I am not bothered by things I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: So, I love the line --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is actually the next step.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I have no idea what's going on.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think people are going to start walking away. At least from the twitter side of this.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because there is not enough room for context. I re-tweeted something that Mike Rowe wrote today on Facebook and response to somebody who called a white nationalist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And his response is so thoughtful. But it takes a lot longer for him to explain it so he does it on Facebook. I thought Tucker Carlson tonight, he said that he basically took Twitter off of all of his devices. And this is actually the next step in all of this which is, just walk away. Walk away from it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Backlash. Backlash.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Two sets of people. And I would include Juan in this, are happier people. You don't read your ad mentions on Twitter. I don't see you ever looking at anything.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He doesn't know how.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no. I know how. But I'm just saying something, I mean, it gets pretty nasty. Right?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Ignore it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You can't. But I will say that you do feel at times like you know what? People find out things. There's gossip. Mostly, trash a gossip or someone -- putting someone down --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But a lot of that is going on and I just say --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is a bathroom wall that never ends.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I do like it for the -- like monitoring breaking news -- I wrote a piece last week in the reformed Jewish journal, I believe that Bethany Mundell had tweeted. And I never would have seen that before but it was about this security guard in Charlottesville that was guarding the synagogue. And now a retired naval officer came over and helped him to be able to protect it. That's something I never would have seen with the course of my --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- news consumption but I don't like to look at the comments.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, and I think that the best part of it. I love Twitter for that because you can't get an access, it's like the really great way to aggregate and get all the different, you know, articles. But, you know, the cheap shots are just, you know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hey, wait a second, I thought I was the one -- you said to Kimberly that I was making excuses when I said, they were reacting to this and worrying about him. But in fact, all of you were saying, well, the social media thing drives people and they are too quick to react.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. If you are trying to expose our hypocrisy, how dare you.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: It's not going to work.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's not going to work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's transition onto something else.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Let's do it. We're "five and friends."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We turned on each other.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Any thoughts on over, we're going to talk about the media response and the people are getting thoughts on the rally?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: The really, yesterday, a lot different than today's speech in Nevada. A lot different from Mondays. I think that the President was pleased with the rally and that's probably most important. I'm really curious to see where this whole thing goes because he has not provided the screaming headlines for his enemies like he has in past weeks. We are going to have to work for the controversy this week.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'd say his base is with him no matter what. So, again, I go back to -- you have this opportunity. You could drive one thing. The most important thing on his legislative agenda for the fall is tax reform. Unless it's the wall. I mean, it could be. Maybe he thinks that the wall is the most important thing. But the House is already put it in the budget and funded it. So, I don't think -- So, it's tax reform. So, it's tax reform. And you have capacity crowds in Arizona, and they are screaming fans and you say, here is what I want, I want tax reform, I wanted on my desk by November 1st and here's what I want in it and here's why it's going to help all of you, now help me get there. I think that would be a better use of his time. I think that the bashing of the media in some ways -- I get it but there's no way to drive the headline. And then again, like the action and overreaction, it is the nitpicking on both sides.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know that it's probably not healthy or positive but I kind of enjoy it, Juan. Does that make me a weak person?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, but it's like pro-wrestling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's just like entertaining.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Little George.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, he does. He labels people.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I mean, imagine if Obama did that to you. I mean, he came after Fox --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. We're going immediate.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, "Saturday Night Live" was not --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They had an overweight man play, you want "Saturday Night Live." Remember that?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: And I had them removed --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And you do that exercise program.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me just quickly jump in and say that I thought that he was reacting throughout much of the speech last night to what had happened with the Charlottesville stuff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And so, he's going after the press. He is pulling out the speech and saying I said this. He doesn't mention he said "both sides." And then he has this guy behind him. And I found this guy tremendously entertaining -- he was a black eye holding up a sign that says "Blacks support Trump." And then you find out, this guy has twice been accused of murder. He's member of a cult. He's saying Obama is the beast and Hillary is some other --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who hasn't done that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I mean, so this is the guy behind the President of the United States.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He is literally behind him.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They should not make sure that their people --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, I thought that you're going to do it Greg and tell me it was --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But don't you remember there was somebody --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: America's most wanted.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A parent of somebody that was -- wasn't Omar Mateen's dad --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. And if the Hillary Clinton --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I don't want to mix my facts up. Because I've done enough of that tonight.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You were correct.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay. Omar Mateen's dad. All right. Coming up, you will hear some of the media's hysterical reaction to President Trump's rally in Phoenix last night. Stay tuned.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: President Trump pounded the media at his rally in Phoenix last night and many in the mainstream media, well, they weren't amused.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: What we have witnessed was a total eclipse of the facts, someone who came out on stage and lied directly to the American people. He's unhinged. It's embarrassing. And I don't mean for us, the media because he went after us but for the country.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: This with incitement plain and simple. I turned my cell phone camera on the crowd just so you could see the reaction there as we were on stage. That's what it looks like when the President turns the crowd on you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: This was Donald Trump at his worst. He sounded like an autocrat trying to dehumanize his allies.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Okay. So, strong reaction from the mainstream media. And you saw that across the board. And I guess it's from all the people, Greg that were not -- there wasn't "Fox & Friends" or "HANNITY" or FNC.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is for the fans. It wasn't for them. For example, it's like going into a concert of the band that you don't like but the fans are screaming, they're crying, you just don't get it. Well, that's not their fault. That's your fault. Under President Obama, I ran into people every day who thought America was heading to ruin under President Obama. Donald Trump was one of them. Now, Trump's in charge, there's another group that believes the world is going to end. The difference here is, they are in the media. They are looking for something that doesn't exist. They expect Donald Trump to stand up there and sue them. That's like expecting a qualifier to, you know, recite Shakespeare. It ain't going to happen. He's not your guy. You have to find soothing somewhere else. And the people that are complaining about, he's disruptive are the same people that are on Twitter seeking conflict.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Okay. So that's who they are.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't think people want to be soothed.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. Dana, so was the reaction won expected by the media to the speech and do you think it's fair?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, yes, to be expected just because it's a pattern. It's like the same thing over and over again. Which is why it's a little bit tiresome. But like for somebody like Cecilia Vega who was actually there on the ground. Like here we are in the comfort of our own studio and we are not there in the crowd and observing it. And that's what they are there to do. And she is absolutely free to express her opinion as is everybody else. But there could be a reaction to that, right? So, people think that they have gone way too far. I think that -- I just don't know if there is actually anything new. I did see something to Greg's point -- Katie Couric tweeted that she had watched the speech and then she said she reread the transcript this morning. She was more afraid for our country than ever. And I do think that that kind of over embellishment of the worries of the country are too much. But I also think that the attacks were, they went too far and I would have used the time much more effectively. Because that base is going to love him no matter what he says. They will roar and cheer for things like tax reform or the wall and whatever he wants to talk about.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Where has everyone been? They act like that was a unique event.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Now all of a sudden you have Carl Bernstein wondering about the mental health of the President. You have James Clapper, who is always sound asleep.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: He comes out and says that the President want out -- he doesn't feel -- he is worried about his hand on the nuclear codes. The guy who actually makes the most sense. David Axelrod said, this is very the talked of him being removed from office, of being mentally imbalance, it's a very dangerous road. That he's got over a third of the country backing him. What are you trying to do, take him out of office after he won an election fair and square?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. So, you made reference to that. We've got that clip. I'll get Juan's reaction.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Juan?

utterances.speaker: JAMES CLAPPER, FORMER DIRECTOR OF NATIONAL INTELLIGENCE
utterances.utterance: I don't know when I've listen and watched something like this from a President that I found more disturbing. I found this downright scary and disturbing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Are you questioning his fitness?

utterances.speaker: CLAPPER
utterances.utterance: Yes, I do. I really question his ability to -- his fitness to be in this office. And I also am beginning to wonder about his motivation for. Maybe he is looking for a way out.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Very interesting. Juan.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: A way out.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He did that rally.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But he said that before he was inaugurated.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: So, he did that rally and, you know, worked up the crowd and did everything so that he could leave the presidency. I mean, that just doesn't make sense to me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think the guy who wrote the art of the deal with him also says that he thinks Trump is looking for a way out. But I don't know.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: I spoke to him in 1988.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't know. There is any significance, that is just people saying this stuff. I take those significance. People like Frank Luntz who used to do, I guess, he still does pulling who said, you know, Trump was more critical of the media in terms of stirring up that crowd than he was neo-Nazis or even radical Islamic terrorists. So, Trump is playing to a base. He's pandering. I don't think he's catering to an appetite of people who say, oh, you know, what, the government is too big. He's just stirring them up. I mean, he's just firing them up.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: But do you think he's sincere?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- bad behavior and anger.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: Do you think he's sincere though? Do you think he's sincerely feels that way? He feels he was misinterpreted. He's watching some of his surrogates and his cabinet --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's what he does things.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: -- on these channels, and seeing no questions about the issues like Afghanistan. And all about personal attacks. I don't think he's pandering. That's Donald Trump. If we went out to dinner with him, he'd be saying the same thing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, but he would be lying. And that's the problem. Because he doesn't say to you -- he doesn't say to you, he says the media is so dishonest. These people are despicable and he doesn't say, oh, yes, but you know what? I did say that both sides are responsible. He doesn't say, oh, you know, I said some things and maybe they were misinterpreted and I sincerely apologize. But here's who I really am. He doesn't say that. He goes after the press.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But here's the difference. Everything you said is true. Everything you said is true. However, it's funny to half of America. When we are watching it, we are actually entertained. We are not taking it that seriously. We are just going oh, it is Uncle Donald. This is great. This is what he does. We see it as fun. The other side is horrified. Like they're watching this horrible destruction of the country.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I have a question then. So, what do you think of it was the reverse? So, if President Obama was highly critical in this way and the rest of the country with laughing? I don't know how we would have reacted.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, I would say that there are people that had an idea that Obama was destroying the country, that he was a secret communist. That everything he did was destroying -- it wasn't that, he was reckless and crazy and unstable, he was more sinister and subversive. But it is a mirror. You see the mirror. The right side of him is subversive and sinister.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: And so, he saw people who are critical of him, he just said it in a more dignified and eloquent way. He resented every day at Fox and you know like in interviews, he would always say, I have a network dedicated just to provide division and destruction. Every day, that was one network. Can you imagine you had 9,000 like Donald Trump? It gets you a little angry.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But I did think that Fox handled it well in saying, like, he didn't overreact, I don't think. But you just like okay, let's continue to ask for interviews. Cover the stories, whatever. I do think when you get to every commentator in the panel last night on CNN having to explain --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh my God!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That it got a little bit again. But again, I am not in their shoes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It was like, they watched the day after, nuclear apocalypse. Their faces were melting. It was like, you guys --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It was little over the top.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: And what it does is, it goes back to why half of the population thinks it's funny. There's something wrong.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I keep saying to you is, when he says things like poor Jeffrey Lord, thrown off at CNN.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And then he doesn't -- what?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: What's wrong with that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He didn't mention. This is why I am telling you about deception and lies by omission. Oh, yes, Jeffrey Lord tweeted out Steve Hyle --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I guess it's a part of the continuation --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I was telling you, he doesn't say these things. And then you get into horrible situations where his people go outside and say, you know, John McCain should die and then Meghan McCain, our colleagues says, you know, that's cruelty. What are you doing?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Trump supporter also got like, coldcocked by a protester.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's a wrap. Smile, Greg. New audio just released from Hillary Clinton's upcoming book on her election disaster. The moment that made her skin crawl during the campaign. We will play it, next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Remember the second Presidential debate between Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton? That was the one were the two are allowed to roam around the stage. That debate was just two days after the release of the infamous access Hollywood tapes. And Hillary Clinton is speaking out about her experience that night. In her new upcoming book, about the election it is called, "What happened?" Secretary Clinton narrated the audio version of the book herself, take a listen to the excerpt?

utterances.speaker: HILLARY CLINTON, FORMER SECRETARY OF STATE
utterances.utterance: This is not ok, I thought. It was the second Presidential debate and Donald Trump was looming behind me. It was incredibly uncomfortable. He was literally breathing down my neck. My skin crawled. Stay calm, keep smiling and carry on as if he weren't repeatedly invading your space. Or do you turn, look him in the eye, and say loudly and clearly, back up, you creep. Get away from me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right Greg you are often accused of being physically intimidating around people. How would you have dealt with that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have to say that. Calling Trump a creep? She should know, she is the expert. She is the Marlin Perkins of creep kingdom. She is up close with a creep in its natural habitat. A frat house filing a noise complaint. She was with the ultimate creep. By the way an audiobook. A book, may be. Audio? No. No. People should want to hear your voice but that is like fingernails on a chalkboard doing an audiobook.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think you would have to listen to that at one point, five speed.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's a whole lot of something. Just listening to it, I've been hearing it on Fox all day. It's just brutal. Brutal, brutal, brutal. KILMEADEReal Geminis book on tape, no one gets --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You have to admire their P.R. tech.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.utterance: It is great, we are currently trying to understand why she lost. Now she is just making money off of it. They get there to back her perspective. I thought the book is shattered to the great job of dispassionately running down what happened. I don't need to hear that. Especially that children's voice delivery.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Surely no one at this table is going to begrudge anybody making money off of writing a book and telling their story.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Hired jasper to read the book, Juan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Some Democrats have been trying to get their footing and they want to move on. Because they have to. Right? This book will be very popular. It will look at a lot of play, for the next four weeks, the lead up to the lodge. She will be doing interviews. Probably a gift to President Trump, because he can get out there and talk about her a lot. Does this actually help the Democrats at this moment to have the book come out? Or just trying to get their footing?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't think so because of just what you said. It's the big trees, taking the sunlight away from the saplings that might be coming up in the Democrats. They are having some intense discussions trying to find their way. I don't know if this hurts them. I think Trump, of course lock her up and all the rest will come back. What strikes me here the most is when you listen to the little bits we are getting out of the book, she goes back pretty strongly and says she thought she got absolutely damaged by the email story. The emails story is way out of proportion. I can't argue with her on that point. I think there are lots of people especially conservatives who want to beat her up. I think they would delight in her saying not being accountable for the fact that she lost an election by all accounts she should have won.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. Is there a controversy viewing over President Trump's proposed boarding walls? We will have the story after this very quick break.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is there a September showdown brewing between the congress and Trump the White House?
